p: Pompia was bestowed the Slow Food Presidium in 2004 [ 12]: as a peculiar and interesting ecotype, important in the Sardinian economy for its preference among consumers, Pompia represents an important biodiversity to preserve. The present study aims at aiding the botanical classification of this species through the phytochemical evaluation of the essential oil of both peels and leaves of Pompia, using a multi-organ approach. Moreover, it presents the Pompia peel essential oil antioxidant properties and the activity in inhibiting molds and bacteria growth, all of which, to the best of our knowledge, have never been investigated before.
